result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Arraignment on November 17, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Phone call from Atty Schuchart and Jordan/DA's office rescheduled the ARGN that was set on 10/13/2022 at 1pm to 11/17/2022 at 1pm. This was rescheduled at the request of Atty Schuchart.

9:59 AM Prosecuting attorney Amy R. Greenwood Pautzke in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Mark D. Halverson in court, in custody.  Attorney Lee D Schuchart in court for Mark D. Halverson. VWC Rachael Race in court. Victim rights. State calls Investigator Plotkin whom is sworn and testifies. Cross exam by Atty Schuchart. Witness excused. Based on evidence heard the Court finds probable cause a felony has been committed and defendant is bound over to the circuit court. Defendant ordered to appear at next hrg. Present bond cont'd.
Arraignment scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Arraignment on October 13, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

9:52 AM Prosecuting attorney Amy R. Greenwood Pautzke in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Mark D. Halverson appeared by in court, in custody.  Attorney Lee D Schuchart in court for Mark D. Halverson. VWC Rachael Race in court. Court makes stmt re discussion held off record in open court w/ defendant and counsel present. Mutual agreement by counsel to postpone PH which would still be withing the 10 days requested by defendant on 9/2/2022. Defendant ordered to appear at next hrg. Present bond con'td.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.

11:52 AM Prosecuting attorney Amy R. Greenwood Pautzke in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Mark D. Halverson appeared by video, in custody, from Oconto County Jail.  Attorney Lee D Schuchart in court for Mark D. Halverson. Court makes stmt re findings of doc # 24. Defendant agrees w/ findings of report and request court to find defendant competent. No objection from the State. Court finds defendant competent and proceeds w/ the case. Atty Schuchart request PH within time limits. Defendant ordered to appear at next hrg. Present bond cont'd.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 6, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Competency hearing on September 2, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Phone call to Alexa/Atty Schuchart and Jordan/DA's office scheduled competency hearing on 9/2/2022 at 11:30am. Jordan will prepare writ/transport letter.

for Treatment.  
Copy of Order, Criminal Complaint and Dr's Report emailed to DHS and WI Forensic Unit on 6/10/2022 @ 8:28AM.
Defense argues bond motion.  Response by State.  Court denies bond motion.  Present bond cont'd.

3:01 PM   Court calls 22CF34, 22FO70/71  Defendant Mark D. Halverson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Edward Daniel Burke Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Lee D Schuchart in court for Mark D. Halverson.   Dr. Speech is by phone.  Deft. in opposition of  Dr. report.  State calls Dr. Speech who is sworn by the court and testifies.  Cross exam by the Defense.  Court questions Dr. Speech.  Argument by counsel.  Court receives Dr. Speech report and based on that Court finds Deft. incompetent at this time.  Hearing to be scheduled when next competency report rec'd.
Competency hearing on May 26, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

9:05 AM Defendant Mark D. Halverson appeared by video from OC Jail, in custody.  Attorney Lee D Schuchart in court for Mark D. Halverson. Attorney Edward Daniel Burke Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Court makes stmt. Atty Schuchart makes stmt. His client is contesting the conclusions of the report and is requesting a contested hearing. Atty Schuchart makes stmt re bond. DA Burke inquires if Dr can appear by telephone. All parties approve Dr to appear by phone. Defendant ordered to appear at next hearing and a NOH was given to Court Security to give to defendant in OCJ.
Competency hearing scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
and Cover Sheet for Confidential Records

03:08 PM Defendant Mark D. Halverson in custody and appeared by video from the OC Jail. Attorney Lee D Schuchart in court.  Edward Daniel Burke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Rachael Race/VWC in court. Court makes stmt - has not received comp exam as of today's hrg. Atty Schchart makes stmt.  Defendant makes stmt. Victim rights. Court makes stmt re letter from defendant and returns the letter to Atty Schuchart - document never filed w/ the Court. Present bond cont'd.  Competency hearing scheduled for May 4, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Order for Competency Exam and Criminal Complaint emailed to DHHS and WI Forensic Unit 8:51am

Halverson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Complaint reveiwed.  Would like competency eval.  Probable cause found.  Atty Schuchart to prepare order.  Bond continues.
